An integral part of the 'Delivery' multi-value set, this field contains a message class ID, (defined in EB.ADVICES). There may be many classes specified, but only classes, which are related to the operation, will be triggered. For example, the EB.ADVICES number LC-3801 (L/C Export Sight Drawing) may have the following classes and messages: Message No. : 1798 EB.MESSAGE.CLASS : NOTIFICATION Message No. : 754 - EB.MESSAGE.CLASS : OPERATIONS Message No. : 742 - EB.MESSAGE.CLASS> : REIMBURSING Assume that the EB.MESSAGE.CLASS ID has been mapped to L/C internal class specified in LC.PARAMETERS as follows: BASIC.MESSAGE = OPERATIONS NOTIFICATION = NOTIFICATION REIMBURSING = REIMBURSING In the L/C Transaction, the system will always populate the OPERATIONS and NOTIFICATION class when the L/C is issued. The REIMBURSING class will only be triggered, when THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY field (REIMBURSING bank in this case) in LETTER.OF.CREDIT has filled up. In combination with the field (SEND.MESSAGE), you can choose whether you want to produce the messages by flipping the YES/NO flag.

Input in this field signifies either that the customer is being debited for a sight bill, which was previously debited to an Internal account or is adjusted to a Loan account. Valid inputs are DEBITED and TRFLOAN. While the former is used to signify that Customer account is debited the latter implies that the payable component has been converted to a Loan.
When DEBITED is chosen, the discount amount that is yet to be amortized is either credited to the account of the Discount party charged or booked to the P&L account as determined by RETURN.INTEREST.

If TRFLOAN is chosen, the amount of discount yet to be amortized along with the discount already amortized is credited to the Discount party charged by reversing out the P&L entries as well. Input in this field is allowed only when the contract is matured Online or Backdated.

p.p: Cannot be input for Extension and Pre-closure (where the NEW.MATURITY.DATE is greater than Today).

This field is for Sender to Receiver (i.e. Sending bank to Receiving bank) Information. Any information entered into this field will appear on a S.W.I.F.T. MT202 message (General Financial Institution Transfer).
It may be used to provide instructions or additional information for the Receiver, Intermediary, Account with Institution or Beneficiary Institution.
This field corresponds to field 72 on S.W.I.F.T. messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message.
Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - type SW Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. (Optional input)
If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a codeword followed by further information.

All code words must be valid code words as defined in S.W.I.F.T. documentation and must conform to the rules specified. Use of invalid code words will cause a message rejection when validated by S.W.I.F.T.
Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by a double slash '//'

This field enables the user to divert a particular message type to another (third) party. The user has a number of options: Simple insertion of a name or address. This will re-route the message in PRINT format to the named party. The code 'TX-' followed by a telex number. This will re-route the message by TELEX to the number detailed. The code 'SW-' followed by a S.W.I.F.T. code. This will re-route the message by SWIFT to the respective bank. The code 'C-' followed by a valid customer number or mnemonic. This will re-route the message in PRINT format to the customer indicated.
